rules: Rule1: If drug X is approved, then item L is marketable.

Rule2: In the event that method P is validated, then if process Q is optimized, then provided that the absence of contamination in batch S is not contingent on the failure of synthesizing chemical U to ensure product R's safety, product R becomes profitable.
Rule3: If equipment N is sterile, then facility M is sanitized.
Rule4: Whenever facility M is sanitized, it is not the case that item O is recalled.
Rule5: Technology J is licensed, or formula K is patented, or in the case that item L is marketable, product R is safe.
Rule6: Lot H is rejected, or test I is not failed.
Rule7: Technology Y is tested, or if drug X is approved, then product R is safe.
Rule8: Assuming standard G is compliant, lot H is not rejected.
Rule9: If substance E is pure, then compound D is stable.
Rule10: Whenever compound D is stable, product R is safe.
Rule11: In the event that regulatory A is approved, side effect B is not harmful.
Rule12: Should results X be published, then trial Y is successful.
Rule13: Either plant Z is cultivated, or device W is manufactured.
Rule14: Provided that cleanroom V is maintained, then if equipment N is sterile, item O is not recalled.
Rule15: Whenever environment U is monitored, then if equipment N is sterile, item O is not recalled.
Rule16: If facility S is audited, then in the scenario that either cleanroom V is not maintained or environment U is not monitored, area T is not contaminated.
Rule17: Assuming device W is manufactured, product R is safe.
Rule18: Compound V is researched, or if plant Z is cultivated, then product R is safe.
Rule19: Should chemical U be synthesized, then substance E is pure.
Rule20: Either chemical U is synthesized, or sample T is analyzed.
Rule21: If sample T is analyzed, then product R is safe.
Rule22: In the event that it is not the case that treatment C being effective leads to product R being profitable, then side effect B is harmful.
Rule23: Should it not be true that cultivating plant Z ensures product R's safety, then test I is failed.
Rule24: If either cleanroom V is not maintained or environment U is not monitored, then area T is contaminated.
Rule25: In the scenario that synthesizing chemical U does not guarantee product R's safety, batch S is not contaminated.
Rule26: If the absence of contamination in batch S is not a consequence of the failure of synthesizing chemical U to ensure product R's safety, then treatment C is effective.

Rule27: If it is not the case that publishing results X leads to the condition where product R is profitable despite batch S not being contaminated from the safety failure of synthesizing chemical U, then paper W is retracted.

Rule28: Whenever the publication of results X does not entail the profitability of product R under the non-contamination of batch S from the safety failure of synthesizing chemical U, then paper W is not retracted.
Rule29: Should standard G not be compliant, then lab F is certified.
Rule30: In the scenario that standard G is not compliant, lab F is not certified.
Rule31: If regulatory A is not approved, then substance Z is banned.
Rule32: Provided that product R is not safe, item O is recalled.
facts: Fact6: Formula K is not patented.
Fact7: Technology J is not licensed.
Fact8: Technology Y is not tested.
Fact9: Substance Z is not banned.
Fact10: Trial Y is not successful.
Fact11: Compound V is not researched.
Fact12: Product R is not profitable.
